text: the AWS customer carbon footprint tool
allows you to view the estimated carbon
footprint associated with your usage of
AWS services helping you to track
measure and review the carbon emissions
generated from your AWS usage
sustainability is both a personal
responsibility as much as it is a
business priority aws has the most
extensive global infrastructure and
builds with sustainability in mind
sustainability is integrated into the
way we design build and operate our
infrastructure amazon co-founded the
climate pledge which is our commitment
to reaching net zero carbon by 2040 10
years ahead of the Paris Agreement in
2023 Amazon met its goal seven years
early to match all of the electricity
consumed across our operations including
our data centers with 100% renewable
energy according to Bloomberg New Energy
Finance Amazon is the largest corporate
purchaser of renewable energy in the
world for five years running and has
invested billions of dollars in more
than 600 wind and 88 solar projects
globally and energy isn't the only piece
of the equation water is also a key
factor which is why AWS is committed to
being water positive returning more
water than we use in our direct
operations by 2030 aws cloud has the
most extensive global infrastructure
offering services for millions of users
globally aws relentlessly innovates its
infrastructure to build the most secure
reliable and performant cloud for our
customers worldwide with each stop on
our road map AWS works to maximize
resource efficiency while minimizing
waste we continue to enhance our
circular economy strategy which rests on
three core pillars design better operate
longer and recover more as of September
2024 the AWS circular material use rate
is 30%
meaning that AWS is using 30% recycled
or biio-based plastics in our products
since
2023 over 23 and a2 million AWS hardware
components have been recycled or sold on
the secondary market in 2024 Amazon
signed four new small modular reactor
agreements as part of its plan to
transition to carbon-f free energy
beyond the positive environmental impact
these projects also provide jobs for
local
communities moving to the cloud offers
many benefits including increased
agility and innovation and access to the
broadest portfolio of services a 2024
Accenture study found that the AWS cloud
is up to 4.1 times more energy efficient
than on premises the study also showed
that optimizing these migrated workloads
can reduce the associated carbon
footprint by up to
99% in order to help meet their
sustainability goals and stay compliant
with various regulations customers want
the ability to measure carbon emissions
associated with the usage of AWS cloud
the AWS customer carbon footprint tool
makes it easier to track measure and
review the carbon emissions generated
from your AWS usage here's how it works
estimates are calculated using the
greenhouse gas protocol and are shared
in easy to understand data
visualizations this tool also lets you
review carbon emissions associated with
your usage of AWS services the AWS
wellarchchitected framework helps you
build secure high-erforming resilient
and more efficient infrastructure for a
variety of applications and workloads
the sustainability pillar of the
framework provides you a way to measure
architecture against sustainability
practices and uncover areas for
improvement while focusing on reducing
the energy consumption of your workloads
the framework includes questions aimed
at helping customers evaluate the design
architecture and implementation of
workloads to help reduce energy
consumption and improve
efficiency much more than a simple
checklist it's designed to be a tool
that customers can use to track their
progress towards policies and implement
best practices that support a more
sustainable future
to access the AWS customer carbon
footprint tool first log into the AWS
management console then click your
account name in the top right and select
billing dashboard from there select the
customer carbon footprint tool in the
left navigation bar under cost and usage
analysis you will need a new AWS
identity and access management
permission to access this report
sustainability colon get carbon
footprint
summary once you've loaded the customer
carbon footprint tool you will have the
option to set the time periods you want
to view data is delivered once a month
and you can look back at data up to 36
months as you set your preferred time
periods the dashboard will refresh with
the estimated carbon emissions generated
during that time within the tool you
will see four different sections that
provide insights into your carbon
emissions generated from using
AWS on the top left you'll see your
estimated AWS emissions this is your
total combined scope 1 and scope 2
carbon footprint in tons of CO2E or
carbon dioxide emissions equivalent
calculated using the greenhouse gas
protocol you can also see the emissions
you have avoided because of AWS
renewable energy
purchases in the next section you will
see where your emissions were generated
this data is calculated from the
specific services you use in each AWS
region and aggregated by geography the
customer carbon footprint tool also
provides a breakdown of your emissions
by broad AWS service based on your usage
history you can also review changes in
your emissions over time this data can
be viewed either by month quarter or
year you can click on the download
button on the top left corner of the
customer carbon footprint tool to
download the detailed data as a CSV file
the CSV report provides details for each
AWS account ID carbon emissions data by
metric tons AWS service and geography
this makes it easier for you to either
view the data by dimension of your
choice for instance a quick pivot by
geography than service or ingesting the
data to your current BI system some AWS
customers may see changes in their
estimated AWS carbon footprint over time
these changes reflect adjustments made
in the tool to more accurately estimate
customers carbon footprint from their
use of AWS
to learn more about AWS's sustainability
efforts visit
aws.amazon.com/ sustainability
